name: monarda fistulosa
description: Monarda fistulosa is a wide-ranging North American plant that thrives in all but the wettest soils. The lavender tubular flowers are a very popular nectar source, attracting a wide variety of bees and butterflies. Hummingbirds may also visit. A member of the mint family, Bergamot was historically used by indigenous people for a variety of medicinal applications. The distinctly aromatic leaves are commonly used to make tea. The button seedheads are popular in dried floral arrangements.
